Comments_List: Basic skills - sight reading, ear training, dictations for harmonic progressions and melodies, etc.
Ear training exercises like harmonic dictations, common chord progressions, interval and seventh chord identification, basic understanding of rhythmic patterns.
The class is great but would probably be more helpful if it was more intense (e.g. workload, evaluations) and counted for a full credit.

The strength is that it really helps you approach and analyze new music in a critical and educated way. You leave a lot more confident with sight reading, rhythms, common chord progressions used in all types of music. Another strength is that examples are drawn from all genres of music - so please consider the class even if you are not a "classical" musician. We spent equal amount of time of pop music, jazz, piano/instrumental/electronic, classical music. 

The major weakness is that in order to succeed at these skills, you really have to practice. You go to class (2x per week) to learn practice skills, but if you are really putting in the practice time outside of class, it ends up being way more than a 0.5 credits worth of work and time.
I would definitely recommend this class to anybody seeking to improve their musicianship, e.g. how to improvise or transcribe music.
